title: Differences in major causes of death in countries

content.question: Which of the following best explains the differences in the major causes of death experienced by high-income countries versus low-income countries during the early twenty-first century?

choices.label: Prevalence of cancer causing pollutants in high-income countries
Acceptance of contraception in high-income countries
Greater access to long-term medical care in low-income countries
Changing lifestyle habits and greater longevity in high-income countries

content.answer: Changing lifestyle habits and greater longevity in high-income countries

topic.text: 9.2: Technological Advances and Limitations after 1900 - Disease

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
